describe_tool: miRarchitect is a machine learning-based tool for rational design of artificial miRNAs. The design process involves analyzing the target sequence (input), designing and studying the structure and thermodynamics of siRNA, selecting the best native pri-miRNA scaffold, and developing amiRNA.

advanced_parameters.max_gc_stretch: maximum length of consecutive sequence made of G and C
advanced_parameters.number_of_bps_to_init_duplex_dissociatio: the number of nucleotides which are checked on both ends of the duplex to determine if the duplex will start to dissociate from the correct site
advanced_parameters.min_mfe_difference_between_ends: minimum free energy difference in kcal/mol between dissociation energies of both ends of the duplex, one end has to have lower energy in order to be dissociated as first
advanced_parameters.two_d_structure_differences: maximum number of differences between the 2D structures of designed amiRNA and the natural pre-miRNA being a scaffold for this amiRNA
advanced_parameters.different_prefixes: when the quide strands with prefixes different form the natural pre-miRNA scaffold should/could be considered/are allowed
advanced_parameters.penalty_for_bad_prefix: value added to the score if prefix is not identical with the natural pre-miRNA scaffold)
advanced_parameters.amirna_id: could be chosen from the list of implemented scaffolds
